item.name: Shopper Identity Service
item.description: Through these endpoints, shoppers can initiate self-directed actions from the storefront UI, such as initiating the password reset process, changing passwords, retrieving or updating their account details, and more.

description.content:
Using this endpoint, a shopper can self-register on your portal, to a specific user pool. If no user pool is specified, the default user pool is considered.

1. If email verification is enabled for the user pool, the shopper is created with a `Pending` status. Shoppers in `Pending` status must verify their email addresses through this `POST /shoppers/actions/activate` endpoint. This endpoint is the underlying means to activate account from the user interface.
2. If email verification is disabled, the user is created with an `active` status.

**Note:** A user pool refers to a user directory or database where the shoppers' accounts are stored and maintained for a specific application or service.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Use this endpoint to check if a shopper's login ID exists in a given user pool. If no user pool is specified, the default user pool is be considered to verify the user's login ID.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
When email verification is enabled for a user pool, the shoppers can activate their profiles using this endpoint. If the shopper's profile is already active, the status remains unchanged.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Get verification token to reset the password

request.name: Get verification token to reset the password

description.content:
When a shopper is unable to log in using their current password, they can start a password reset process.
With this endpoint, you can get a verification token that can be used to reset password using the `POST/shoppers/reset-password` endpoint.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

As a prerequisite, use the `POST/shoppers/forgot-password` endpoint to get a verification token. This token is required in this endpoint to reset the password.
If the user pool is not specified, the default user pool is used to reset password.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Shopper Identity Admin Service
item.description: Through these endpoints, storefront administrators can manage shoppers' accounts, such as updating user pool settings, getting shopper details, and updating account statuses.

description.content: With this endpoint, you can get the full list of shoppers associated with your merchant. By specifying the query paramater `userPoolIdQueryParam`, you can get the shoppers from a specified user pool. If `userPoolIdQueryParam` is omitted, you can get shoppers from every user pool of your merchant.

The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, the system return records from 21 to 30. When they are not specified, the system returns up to 10 records.
The maximum number of records per page.
A unique ID of the user pool associated with the shopper.

Using this endpoint, you can update your merchant's user pool settings such as enabling or disabling email verification, updating password policy, setting lockout attempts, and more, for the specified user pool. If a user pool is not specified, the default user pool is considered.

fabric **Shopper Identity** API provides diverse set of functionalities for both regular shoppers as well as the storefront administrators. With this service, shoppers can effectively manage their own accounts, while storefront administrators can manage accounts of all of their shoppers.

Contact Support:
 Name: fabric Support
 Email: support@fabric.inc
